data.title: windows 10 slow performance
data.body:
hello,

When i generate default libgdx project via Setup app, after add a simply fps check in render method:

System.out.println(Gdx.graphics.getFramesPerSecond());

i have in my console max 30 fps.

What is wrong? Any ideas?

configuration:

newest libgdx
intel i5
geforce gtx 960

data.title: Fix reference leak in ComparableTimSort
data.body:
At the moment ComparableTimSort use a ~~static~~ temp array for performing the sort. The array is not clean up after sorting, therefore maintaining ~~static~~ references to the sorted objects.

This pull request simply mimics what is being done in TimSort which correctly cleanup these references after sorting.

data.title: Fixes #3509 and adds a simple test program
data.body:
Tested on Desktop and Android platforms.

The test program is not very efficient, since the `btOverlappingPairCache`, `btCollisionAlgorithm`, `btPersistentManifold` and `btManifoldPoint` classes do not use pooling.

data.title: Java cannot find audio class.
data.body:
#### Issue details

I am trying to learn how to use the library, and while attempting to follow the instructions of the demo project, I am receiving a couple of unusual errors -- that java cannot find the class Audio in com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx, even though it has been imported, and I have checked the code of the library to ensure it is there. I suspect it is a case sensitivity error, but I can't be sure. Regardless, it is a problem, and I have absolutely no idea how to fix this, and after half an hour of Googling the problem and trying out solutions, including cleaning + rebuilding the project, I have been unable to fix this problem. I'm using Intellij IDEA, if that helps.
#### Reproduction steps/code

I haven't seen this anywhere else, but all I do to recreate this is create a new project using the gradle install, and follow the demo as to how you create a new game. Class: http://hastebin.com/sisuruvizi.avrasm
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

The current version used in the Gradle install. 1.9.2, I believe.
#### Stacktrace

``` java
Error:(26, 28) java: cannot find symbol
  symbol:   class audio
  location: class com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx
Error:(27, 28) java: cannot find symbol
  symbol:   class audio
  location: class com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx
```
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] MacOS

data.title: Fix issue with underscores in method names
data.body:
Methods with a underscore, e.g. `_foo()` can't be used with jnigen, because they are 
transformed to `__1foo()` according to the rules defined in table 2-1 at 
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/jni/spec/design.html#wp615
They can't be used, because jnigen always looks for "_" + methodName so jnigen looks for a 
function `__foo()` which doesn't exist.

data.title: UBJSON reader/writer: fix for writing long/double/char arrays
data.body:
This is a bug fix for writing and reading long, double and char arrays in UBJSON.

see Issue #3938

data.title: UBJsonWriter writes wrong types for long and double arrays
data.body:
The methods
public UBJsonWriter value (long[] values)
and 
public UBJsonWriter value (double[] values)
of the class com.badlogic.gdx.utils.UBJsonWriter
write wrong type information. The resulting stream is not readable, neither by UBJsonReader nor by 
other UBJSON implementations.
#### Issue details

According to the UBJson specification, long arrays must start with "$L", double arrays with "$D".
The UBJsonWriter class wrongly uses "$I" (short values) and "$d" (float values).
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.9.2

Pull request for fixing these bugs will follow.

data.title: LWJGL3 Added the possibility to create windows initially hidden
data.body:
Hey folks,

in the moment it is possible to hide windows using Lwjgl3Window#setVisible. This pull requests adds the option to configure windows to be hidden on creation by default. This is handy if the Lwjgl3Application is supposed to only 'spawn' windows using #newWindow. Or (the case why I made the request) if you desire to do offscreen rendering.

While I am not sure if this would be a widely used feature it is a small change and therefor worth considering imho.

-ClaasJG

I saw the code of `com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.VertexArray.bind(ShaderProgram, int[])`,It seems supported GL_FLOAT and `GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE`,But when I what to create a `VertexAttribute` with type `GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE`,I found the constructors is private,so I think, it may be public to provide more control on Vertex Attribute?

data.title: Lwjgl3 error with gl3 enabled
data.body:
#### Issue details

With Lwjgl3 backend, when using GL2, window opens and all works but when using GL3, error appears and application crashes.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

Version 1.9.2
#### Stacktrace

``` java
[LWJGL] Version: 3.0.0b SNAPSHOT
[LWJGL]      OS: Windows 7 v6.1
[LWJGL]     JRE: 1.8.0_65 amd64
[LWJGL]     JVM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM v25.65-b01 by Oracle Corporation
[LWJGL] Loaded library from org.lwjgl.librarypath: lwjgl
[LWJGL] MemoryUtil accessor: MemoryAccessorUnsafe
[LWJGL] Loaded native library: D:\Users\T0143947\AppData\Local\Temp\libgdxT0143947\135ea35f\jemalloc.dll
[LWJGL] MemoryUtil allocator: JEmallocAllocator
[LWJGL] Loaded native library: D:\Users\T0143947\AppData\Local\Temp\libgdxT0143947\135ea35f\glfw.dll
[LWJGL] Loaded native library: D:\Users\T0143947\AppData\Local\Temp\libgdxT0143947\135ea35f\OpenAL.dll
[LWJGL] GLFW_VERSION_UNAVAILABLE error
    Description : WGL: OpenGL profile requested but WGL_ARB_create_context_profile is unavailable
    Stacktrace  :
        org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFW.nglfwCreateWindow(GLFW.java:1168)
        org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFW.glfwCreateWindow(GLFW.java:1251)
        com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Application.createGlfwWindow(Lwjgl3Application.java:365)
        com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Application.createWindow(Lwjgl3Application.java:329)
        com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Application.<init>(Lwjgl3Application.java:93)
        com.realhome.desktop.DesktopLauncher.main(DesktopLauncher.java:14)
Exception in thread "main" com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Couldn't create window
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Application.createGlfwWindow(Lwjgl3Application.java:368)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Application.createWindow(Lwjgl3Application.java:329)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Application.<init>(Lwjgl3Application.java:93)
    at com.realhome.desktop.DesktopLauncher.main(DesktopLauncher.java:14) 
```
#### Details

My computer doesn't seem to have the `WGL_ARB_create_context_profile` extension. 
If I remove this [line](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backend-lwjgl3/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/lwjgl3/Lwjgl3Application.java#L355) , it works.

**Is the OpenGL core profile mandatory in Lwjgl3 ?**

data.title: Clicking a Button creates an enter event followed by an exit event
data.body:
#### Issue details

If I click a button without moving the cursor off of it, its listener's `enter` method is called, followed by its `exit` method. Neither is expected because the cursor has not moved off of the button.
#### Reproduction steps/code

[Run this ApplicationListener](https://gist.github.com/cypherdare/4aa45a300c46e12b1ce2) and watch log while clicking a button. 
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.7.2 (possibly earlier or forever) onwards to at least 1.9.2

data.title: remove texture artifacts for FreeTypeFontGenerator
data.body:
Fixing https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/3521
- `PixmapPacker` has a new parameter `Color currentTransparentColor;` used by `Page` constructor to fill transparent pixels.
- `FreeTypeFontGenerator` sets packer to use color of the font but with zero alpha for transparent pixels to avoid leaks.

data.title: ETC1Data IO fix and update
data.body: https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/3924

data.title: ETC1Data IO fix and update, squashed
ETC1Data IO fix and update
data.body:
In this PR:

Commit 1:
- matryoshka `new DataOutputStream(new GZIPOutputStream(file.write(false)));` was refactored to allow closing `gzipStream` and `dataStream`
- new method `write(OutputStream outputStream)` added
- output `fileStream` properly closed to avoid locking output file.

Commit 2:
- another matryoshka `new DataInputStream(new BufferedInputStream(new GZIPInputStream(pkmFile.read())));` refactored for the same reasons
- new method `static ETC1Data.read(inputStream)` introduced to replace unsafe constructor
- input `fileStream` properly closed to avoid locking input file.

Commit 3:
- class `final` modifier removed to allow class extension for custom implementations.

data.title: ETC1Data output streams fix
data.body:
About this PR:
- closes `DataOutputStream`  and `DataInputStream`
- closes `GZIPOutputStream` and `GZIPInputStream`
- closes `FileOutputStream` and `FileInputStream` to avoid locking the file. In Windows not closing file streams (e.g. `new DataOutputStream(new GZIPOutputStream(file.write(false)));`) locks the file folder until reboot or else.
- adds  `ETC1Data .write(OutputStream os)`
-  `ETC1Data.write(FileHandle file)` now wraps the `ETC1Data.write(OutputStream os)`
- adds  `static ETC1Data.read(InputStream os)`
-  `ETC1Data(FileHandle file)` now wraps the `ETC1Data.read(FileHandle file)` to allow `ETC1Data .read(InputStream os)`

data.title: ETC1Data output streams fix
data.body:
- closes `GZIPOutputStream` 
- closes `OutputStream` to avoid locking the output file
- adds  `ETC1Data .write(OutputStream os)`
-  `ETC1Data.write(FileHandle file)` now wraps the `write(OutputStream os)`

data.title: LWJGL3 Swallowed Exceptions
data.body:
#### Issue details

Exceptions thrown in `ApplicationAdapter#dispose()` swallows other exceptions. Additionally when exception is throw after new window is created, `dispose()` is called on it, but `create()` never was. 
#### Reproduction steps/code

See the gist for SSCEE.
https://gist.github.com/piotr-j/42e6f1caf3ed4b0ca899
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.9.3-SNAPSHOT
#### Stacktrace

``` java
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.AssertionError: Hides them all
    at com.mygdx.game.desktop.ExceptionSwallowTest.dispose(ExceptionSwallowTest.java:31)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Window.dispose(Lwjgl3Window.java:281)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Application.cleanup(Lwjgl3Application.java:152)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Application.<init>(Lwjgl3Application.java:103)
    at com.mygdx.game.desktop.ExceptionSwallowTest.main(ExceptionSwallowTest.java:37)
```
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [x] MacOS

data.title: Dialog flickering .show
data.body:
#### Issue details

Standard Libgdx dialog flickers at .show(stage) function.
#### Reproduction steps/code

Create a bright background, create a dialog and then dialog.show(stage).
(I guess it's when the following happens:
stage.act();
dialog.show(stage);
stage.draw();
but i'm not sure as why it happens. But I know how to fix it)
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.9.2 
#### Stacktrace
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] Android testet
- [ ] iOS
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [X] Windows testet
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS
#### Solution:

following helped in my case:
Color color = dialog.getColor();
color.a = 0;
dialog.setColor(color);
dialog.show();

data.title: Fixed MapObject x/y properties being scaled twice
data.body: The x and y local variables are already scaled on lines 175 and 176 in the BaseTmxMapLoader, and scaling them again when modifying the properties ObjectMap makes the x and y properties too small (and inconsistent with the coordinates of Rectangle/Ellipse/etc if the MapObject in question is an instance of one of those objects).
